duck: Oblique projection, including:
Camera obscura - The camera obscura is an optical device that projects an image of its surroundings on a screen.
Projection
Cavalier projection
Dimetric projection
http://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/projection
Slide projector - A slide projector is an opto-mechanical device to view photographic slides.
projection definition: a systematic presentation of intersecting coordinate lines on a flat surface upon which features from a curved surface (as of the earth or the celestial sphere) may be mapped.
Elevation, usually a side view of an exterior
Section, a view of the interior at a particular cutting plane
Projection screen - A projection screen is an installation consisting of a surface and a support structure used for displaying a projected image for the view of an audience.
Overhead projector - An overhead projector is a variant of slide projector that is used to display images to an audience.
Psychological projection, or "Freudian projection," a defense mechanism in which one attributes to others oneâ€™s own unacceptable or unwanted attributes, thoughts, or emotions
Orthographic projection, including:
Trimetric projection
Plan, or floor plan view
Movie projector - A movie projector is an opto-mechanical device for displaying motion picture film by projecting it onto a screen.
Video projector - A video projector is an image projector that receives a video signal and projects the corresponding image on a projection screen using a lens system.
Axonometric projection, including:
Merriam-Webster
Graphical projection, the production of a two-dimensional image of a three-dimensional object
Cabinet projection
Map projection, reducing a three-dimensional planet to a flat map (geography)
Isometric projection - Isometric projection is a method for visually representing three-dimensional objects in two dimensions in technical and engineering drawings.
Parallel projection - Parallel projections have lines of projection that are parallel both in reality and in the projection plane.
